subraces.name: Protector
subraces.description:
You can use two actions to unleash the divine energy within yourself, causing your eyes to glimmer and two luminous, incorporeal wings to sprout from your back.

Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as an action. During it, you have a flying speed of 20 feet.

On each of your turns,you can mark one of your allies with a glowing aura. Whenever they are struck by an enemy attack or spell that enemy takes Light damage equal to your level.

You can use this trait once per day

subraces.name: Sourge
subraces.description:
You can use two actions to unleash the divine energy within yourself, causing a searing light to radiate from you, pour out of your eyes and mouth, and threaten to char you.

Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as an action. During it, you shed bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.

At the end of each of your turns, you and each creature within 10 feet of you take Light damage equal to your level.

Additionally, On each of your turns, you can deal extra Light damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell. The extra Light damage equals your level.

You can use this trait once per day

subraces.name: Fallen
subraces.description:
You can use two actions to unleash the divine energy within yourself, causing your eyes to turn into pools of darkness and two skeletal, ghostly, flightless wings to sprout from your back.

The instant you transform, other creatures within 10 feet of you that can see you must each succeed on a Will saving throw (DC 9 + your level + your Charisma modifier) or become frightened of you until the end of your next turn.

Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as an action. During it, once on each of your turns, you can deal extra Dark damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell. The extra Dark damage equals your level.

You can use this trait once per day

generalPerks.name: Healing Hands
generalPerks.description: As an action, you can touch a creature and cause it to regain a number of hit points equal to your level. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a rest.

generalPerks.name: Divine Blessing
generalPerks.description:
You learn a Divine cantrip of your choice. Charisma is your spellcasting modifier for it.

You are proficient in the use of this cantrip

generalPerks.name: Celestial Resistance
generalPerks.description: You have resistance to Dark damage or Light damage.

generalPerks.name: Powerful Presence
generalPerks.description: You have apprentice proficiency in two of the following skills: Persuasion, Intimidation, and Society.

generalPerks.name: Stronger Together
generalPerks.description: You have advantage on all checks to assist an ally in a skill that you have at least Trained proficiency level in.

generalPerks.name: Talented
generalPerks.description: You gain one skill increase to a skill of your choosing

generalPerks.name: Low-Light Vision
generalPerks.description: You can see in dim light as though it were by torchlight, but cannot see in darkness.

subraces.name: Sprinter
subraces.description:
Your reflexes and agility allow you to move with a burst of speed. When you move on your turn in combat, you can double your speed until the end of the turn. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you move 0 feet on one of your turns.

Your move speed increases by 5 feet.

subraces.name: Stalker
subraces.description:
You gain the Trained proficiency level in the stealth skill.

You have a climbing speed of 15 feet.

subraces.name: Pridelord
subraces.description:
You have advantage on all ability checks against being frightened.

You gain the following ability: As an action, you can let out an especially menacing roar. Creatures of your choice within 10 feet of you that can hear you must succeed on a Will saving throw or become frightened of you until the end of your next turn.

The DC of the save equals 9 + your level + your Constitution modifier.

Once you use this trait, you canâ€™t use it again until you finish a rest.

generalPerks.name: Powerful Swimmer
generalPerks.description: You have a swim speed of 15 feet.

generalPerks.name: Lightfoot
generalPerks.description: You do not set off pressure plates, tripwires, or other ground based traps.

generalPerks.name: Nimble Dodge
generalPerks.description: When you fail a Reflex save, you can use your reaction to reroll the save and keep the new result. You can use this ability once per day.

generalPerks.name: Nine Lives
generalPerks.description:
When you take damage that would reduce your hit points to 0, you can choose to be reduced to 1 hit point instead.

You may only use this ability Nine times, and it does not recharge.

generalPerks.name: Cat's Claws
generalPerks.description: Your retractable claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to 1d4 + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

generalPerks.name: Masterful Hunter
generalPerks.description: You have apprentice level proficiency in stealth and survival.

generalPerks.name: Lowlight Vision
generalPerks.description: You can see in dim light as though it were by torchlight, but cannot see in darkness.

subraces.name: Air Djinni
subraces.description:
You have resistance to Thunder damage, and can hold your breath indefinitely while not incapacitated.

Advanced Movement (if selected): Fly speed 10 feet

Djinn Spellcasting (if selected): You know the Lightning Lash and Gust cantrips. You know the spell Thunderwave and can cast it once per day as a 1st-level innate spell.

Advanced Spells (if selected): At 3rd level, you learn the spell Shatter and Levitate, and can cast them each once per day as a 2nd-level innate spell.

subraces.name: Earth Djinni
subraces.description:
You have resistance to Poison damage, and advantage on all saving throws against being poisoned.

Advanced Movement (if selected): Burrow speed 10 feet

Djinn Spellcasting (if selected): You know the Druidcraft and Primal Savagery cantrips. You know the spell Catapult and can cast it once per day as a 1st-level innate spell.

Advanced Spells (if selected): At 3rd level, you learn the spell Earthen Grasp and Barkskin, and can cast each of them once per day as a 2nd-level innate spell.

subraces.name: Fire Djinni
subraces.description:
You have resistance to Fire damage

Advanced Movement (if selected): Movement speed increases by 10 feet

Djinn Spellcasting (if selected): You know the Produce Flame cantrip. You know the spell Burning Hands and can cast it once per day as a 1st-level innate spell.

Advanced Spells (if selected): At 3rd level, you learn the spell Flaming Sphere and Flame Blade, and can cast each of them once per day as a 2nd-level innate spell.

subraces.name: Water Djinni
subraces.description:
You have resistance to Cold damage, and can breathe both air and water.

Advanced Movement (if selected): Swimming speed 10 feet

Djinn Spellcasting (if selected): You know the Acid Splash and Shape water cantrips. You know the spell Ice Knife and can cast it once per day as a 1st-level innate spell.

Advanced Spells (if selected): At 3rd level, you learn the spell Acid Arrow and Snowball Swarm, and can cast each of them once per day as a 2nd-level innate spell.

generalPerks.name: Wish-Granter
generalPerks.description: Once per day, you can give an ally advantage on any attack, ability check, or saving throw.

generalPerks.name: Future-Sight
generalPerks.description: At the beginning of every day, roll a d20 and record the result. Once per day, you can replace any roll you make with the recorded result. This roll ONLY replaces the rolled value, not any modifiers or bonuses you may have.

generalPerks.name: Advanced Movement
generalPerks.description: You gain the advanced movement ability detailed under your chosen subrace.

generalPerks.name: Djinni Spellcasting
generalPerks.description:
You gain the Djinn Spellcasting feature detailed under your chosen subrace.

Constitution is your spellcasting modifier for these spells. You are proficient in the use of these spells.

generalPerks.name: Advanced Djinni Spellcasting
generalPerks.description: You gain the Advanced Spells ability detailed under your chosen subrace.

generalPerks.name: Semi-Cosmic Knowledge
generalPerks.description: You gain the Apprentice proficiency in two skills of your choice.

generalPerks.name: Low-Light Vision
generalPerks.description: You can see in dim light as though it were by torchlight, but cannot see in darkness.

subraces.name: Forge-born
subraces.description: You are resistant to Fire damage, and have Apprentice proficiency in Crafting

subraces.name: Iron-mind
subraces.description: You have advantage on all Will saves against magical effects

subraces.name: Rock-foot
subraces.description:
You have advantage on athletics checks against being grappled, shoved, or knocked prone. Your fists are as if made of stone. Your unarmed attacks do 1d6 + your strength modifier bludgeoning damage.

If you do not already have proficiency with unarmed attacks, your proficiency is Trained for the purposes of determining your attack modifiers.

subraces.name: Strong-blood
subraces.description:
You are resistant to Poison damage, and have advantage on all saves against poison.

Additionally whenever you gain hit points at the end of a rest, you can gain additional hit points equal to your level.

generalPerks.name: Dwarven Armor Training
generalPerks.description: You reduce the movement penalties from heavy and medium armor by 5 feet. You gain proficiency in light armor. If you already have proficiency in light armor, you instead gain proficiency in medium armor. If you already have proficiency in medium armor, you gain proficiency in heavy armor.

generalPerks.name: Dwarven Combat Training
generalPerks.description: You are proficient with the battleaxe, handaxe, light hammer, and warhammer.

generalPerks.name: Dwarven Toughness
generalPerks.description: Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.

generalPerks.name: Clan Artisan
generalPerks.description:
You gain Apprentice proficiency with the Crafting skill, as well as with the artisan's tools of your choice. If you would already gain Apprentice proficiency in Crafting, you gain the Trained proficiency level instead.

In addition, You have advantage on any check relating to stonework or any other dwarven craftsmanship.

generalPerks.name: One with the Mountain
generalPerks.description:
You can cast the spell Meld into Stone once per day as an innate spell.

Accustomed to life under the mountain, you are incapable of (naturally) getting lost while underground. You are capable of retracing your steps or finding your way to the surface.

You can cast the spell Enlarge once per day as a 2nd-level innate spell. You may only use the enlarge option, and may only target yourself.

generalPerks.name: Low-light Vision
generalPerks.description: You can see in dim light as though it were by torchlight, but cannot see in darkness.

subraces.name: Sea
subraces.description:
You are resistant to Cold damage.

You have a swim speed of 15 feet and can breathe both air and water.

subraces.name: High
subraces.description: You have advantage on all Will saves against magical effects.

subraces.name: Wood
subraces.description: As an action, you can magically turn invisible until the start of your next turn or until you attack, make a damage roll, cast a spell, or force someone to make a saving throw. You may use this trait once per day.

generalPerks.name: Elf Magic
generalPerks.description:
You know one cantrip of your choice from the Arcane or Primal spell list. If you chose an Arcane spell, Intelligence is your spellcasting modifier for it. If you chose a Primal spell, Wisdom is your spellcasting modifier for it.

You are proficient in the casting of this spell.

generalPerks.name: Elven Weapon Training
generalPerks.description: You are proficient with the longsword, shortsword, shortbow, and longbow.

generalPerks.name: Fleet of Foot
generalPerks.description: You gain Apprentice proficiency in the Acrobatics skill, and each of your movement speeds increases by 5 feet.

generalPerks.name: Mask of the Wild
generalPerks.description: You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

generalPerks.name: Vast Knowledge (Requires age 250+)
generalPerks.description: You gain the Trained proficiency in a skill of your choice.

generalPerks.name: Elven Step
generalPerks.description: When you Step, you may move up to half your movement speed rather than the standard 5 feet.

generalPerks.name: Low-Light Vision
generalPerks.description: You can see in dim light as though it were by torchlight, but cannot see in darkness.

subraces.name: Longarm
subraces.description: You have a reach of 10 feet when making melee attacks. This does not stack with other range increasing effects.

subraces.name: City Walker
subraces.description: You can cast Disguise Self at will, appearing up to 3 feet shorter than normal, allowing you to blend in more naturally with humans and elves.

subraces.name: Hidden One
subraces.description: As an action, you can magically turn invisible until the start of your next turn or until you attack, make a damage roll, cast a spell, or force someone to make a saving throw. You may use this trait once per day.

subraces.name: Guardian of Nature
subraces.description: You can cast the spell Barkskin and Entangle each once per day. Wisdom is your spellcasting modifier for these spells. You are proficient in the casting of these spells

generalPerks.name: Powerful Build
generalPerks.description: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift. The movement penalty for armor and shields is reduced by 5 feet.

generalPerks.name: Fey Magic
generalPerks.description: You know one cantrip of your choice from the Primal spell list. Wisdom is your spellcasting Ability for it. You are proficient in the casting of this spell.

generalPerks.name: Speech of Beast and Leaf
generalPerks.description: You have the Ability to communicate in a limited manner with beasts and plants. They can understand the meaning of your words, though you have no special Ability to understand them in return. You have advantage on all Charisma checks you make to influence them.

generalPerks.name: Longstrider
generalPerks.description: Your movement speed increases by 5

generalPerks.name: One with Nature
generalPerks.description: You have Trained proficiency in the Nature Skill

generalPerks.name: Read the Leaves
generalPerks.description: You have advantage on all survival checks while in forest or woods.

generalPerks.name: Low-Light Vision
generalPerks.description: You can see in dim light as though it were by torchlight, but cannot see in darkness

subraces.name: Forest
subraces.description: As an action, you can magically turn invisible until the start of your next turn or until you attack, make a damage roll, cast a spell, or force someone to make a saving throw. You may use this trait once per day.

subraces.name: Rock
subraces.description: You have advantage on all Will saves against magic.

generalPerks.name: Natural Illusionist
generalPerks.description: You know the Minor Illusion cantrip. Intelligence is your spellcasting modifier for it. You are proficient in its casting.

generalPerks.name: Gnomish Obsession
generalPerks.description: You gain Apprentice proficiency with one skill of your choice. At 5th level, your proficiency with this skill increases by one level (up to a maximum of Expert).

generalPerks.name: Speak with Small Beasts
generalPerks.description: Through sound and gestures, you may communicate simple ideas with small or smaller beasts.

generalPerks.name: Artificer's Lore
generalPerks.description: Whenever you make a History check related to magical, alchemical, or technological items, you can do so with advantage. You have Apprentice proficiency in the Lore / History skill.

generalPerks.name: Nimble
generalPerks.description: You can move through the space of any creature that is of a size larger than yours.

generalPerks.name: Gnomish Tinkering
generalPerks.description:
You have Apprentice proficiency in crafting. You can spend 1 hour and 10 gp worth of materials to construct a Tiny clockwork device (AC 5, 1 hp).

The device ceases to function after 24 hours (unless you spend 1 hour repairing it to keep the device functioning), or when you use your action to dismantle it; at that time, you can reclaim the materials used to create it. You can have up to three such devices active at a time.

These devices can be used to create a number of effects. The Prestidigitation cantrip is a good baseline for such effects, though your DM has the final ruling

generalPerks.name: Low-Light Vision
generalPerks.description: You can see in dim light as though it were by torchlight, but cannot see in darkness.

subraces.name: Charhide
subraces.description: You have resistance to Fire and Acid damage

subraces.name: Irongut
subraces.description: You have resistance to poison damage, and are immune to the poisoned condition.

subraces.name: Unbreakable
subraces.description:
You gain 12 hit points instead of 6 from your race at 1st level.

The first time you are knocked unconscious each day, you don't gain a wound upon being stabilized.

subraces.name: Tailed
subraces.description: You have a tail, gain the Apprentice proficiency in Acrobatics, and have a climb speed of 15 feet.

generalPerks.name: Goblin Thievery
generalPerks.description: You gain Apprentice proficiency in thievery and stealth.

generalPerks.name: Rough Rider
generalPerks.description: You can successfully mount and command medium sized animals that would otherwise not be trainable as mounts (dogs, wolves, goats, giant badgers, etc...).

generalPerks.name: Very Sneaky
generalPerks.description: You suffer no movement penalty while attempting to sneak.

generalPerks.name: Fury of the Small
generalPerks.description:
When you damage a creature with an attack or spell and the creature's size is larger than yours, you can cause the attack or spell to deal extra damage to the creature. The extra damage equals your level.

Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until after your next rest.

generalPerks.name: Goblin Scuttle
generalPerks.description: You gain the following reaction: When an ally ends a move adjacent to you, you can immediately use the disengage action.

generalPerks.name: Keen Senses
generalPerks.description: You have advanced hearing and smell, and have advantage on perception checks relating those senses.

generalPerks.name: Low-Light Vision
generalPerks.description: You can see in dim light as though it were by torchlight, but cannot see in darkness.

subraces.name: Black
subraces.description:
You are resistant to Acid damage.

Breath weapon (if selected): Cone - Fortitude save

subraces.name: Copper
subraces.description:
You are resistant to Acid damage.

Breath weapon (if selected):  Line - Fortitude save

subraces.name: Blue
subraces.description:
You are resistant to Lightning damage.

Breath weapon (if selected): Cone - Reflex save

subraces.name: Bronze
subraces.description:
You are resistant to Lightning damage.

Breath weapon (if selected): Line - Reflex save

subraces.name: Red
subraces.description:
You are resistant to Fire damage.

Breath weapon (if selected): Cone - Reflex save

subraces.name: Brass
subraces.description:
You are resistant to Fire damage.

Breath weapon (if selected): Line - Reflex save

subraces.name: Gold
subraces.description:
You are resistant to Fire damage.

Breath weapon (if selected): Line - Reflex save

subraces.name: Green
subraces.description:
You are resistant to Poison damage.

Breath weapon (if selected): Line - Fortitude save

subraces.name: Steel
subraces.description:
You are resistant to Poison damage.

Breath weapon (if selected): Line - Fortitude save

subraces.name: White
subraces.description:
You are resistant to Cold damage

Breath weapon (if selected): Cone - Fortitude save

subraces.name: Silver
subraces.description:
You are resistant to Cold damage

Breath weapon (if selected): Line - Fortitude save

generalPerks.name: Breath Weapon
generalPerks.description:
You can use an action to exhale destructive energy. When you use your breath weapon, all creatures in the target area must make a saving throw, the type and shape of which is determined by your ancestry.

The DC of this saving throw is 9 + your Constitution modifier + your level. A creature takes 2d6 + your Constitution modifier damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one. The damage type is determined by your ancestry.

The damage increases to 3d6 at 3rd level, 4d6 at 5th, and 5d6 at 10th level.

You may use your breath weapon once per day.

generalPerks.name: Hardened Scales
generalPerks.description: Your scales provide you with a natural suit of armor. Your scales provide a Defense bonus of +3, with no Dexterity cap, and an Armor value of 1.

generalPerks.name: Draconic Claws
generalPerks.description: You grow retractable claws from the tips of your fingers. Extending or retracting the claws requires no action. The claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier, instead of the normal bludgeoning damage for an unarmed strike.

generalPerks.name: Iron Jaws
generalPerks.description:
You can use your action to make a visceral bite attack with your draconic maw. This attack does damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier, and provides you with a number of temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt with this attack.

You are proficient with this attack, but can only gain its benefits once per day.

generalPerks.name: Imposing Predator
generalPerks.description: You gain Apprentice proficiency in the intimidation skill, and have advantage on all saving throws against becoming frightened.

generalPerks.name: Survivalist
generalPerks.description: You gain Trained proficiency in the survival skill.

generalPerks.name: Low-Light Vision
generalPerks.description: You can see in dim light as though it were by torchlight, but cannot see in darkness.

subraces.name: Crag-Hopper
subraces.description:
You are resistant to Cold damage.

You do not need to stride before making a long jump, and have advantage on all athletics checks to jump, long jump or high jump.

subraces.name: Sand-Walker
subraces.description:
You are resistant to Fire damage.

Your movement speed is increased by 5 feet

generalPerks.name: Powerful Build
generalPerks.description: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift. The movement penalty for armor and shields is reduced by 5 feet.

generalPerks.name: Stone's Endurance
generalPerks.description: You can focus yourself to occasionally shrug off injury. When you take damage, you can use your reaction to roll a d12. Add your Constitution modifier to the number rolled, and reduce the damage received by that total. You can use this ability once per day.

generalPerks.name: Survival of the Fittest
generalPerks.description: You gain Trained proficiency in the Athletics skill.

generalPerks.name: Deadly Velocity
generalPerks.description: When you make an attack with a thrown weapon, that weapon's range increments are doubled.

generalPerks.name: Towering Presence
generalPerks.description: You gain Apprentice proficiency in the Intimidation skill, and have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

generalPerks.name: Wild Companion
generalPerks.description:
You have a familiar, which is a fey spirit bound to you in the wilds during your youth. This familiar takes whatever form you choose, but usual forms typically possess a fly speed.

This familiar behaves as though summoned by the find familiar spell (with the following changes) and you can cast Find Familiar (without expending any spell charges or material components) only to resummon this familiar.

Your familiar is always of the type: fey, your familiar is incapable of changing its physical form even when resummoned, and your familiar is incapable of taking any actions in combat.

generalPerks.name: Low-Light Vision
generalPerks.description: You can see in dim light as though it were by torchlight, but cannot see in darkness.

subraces.name: Lightfoot
subraces.description:
You can attempt to hide even when you are only obscured by a creature that is at least one size larger than you.

You gain Apprentice proficiency in the stealth skill.

subraces.name: Stout
subraces.description:
You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance to poison damage.

Whenever you gain hit points at the end of a rest, you can gain additional hit points equal to your level.

generalPerks.name: Brave
generalPerks.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

generalPerks.name: Nimble
generalPerks.description: You can move through the space of any creature that is of a size larger than yours.

generalPerks.name: Lucky
generalPerks.description: When you roll a 1 on an attack roll, Ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die. You must use the new result, even if it is a 1.

generalPerks.name: Halfling Charm
generalPerks.description: You have Apprentice proficiency with the Persuasion skill, and can give yourself advantage on a persuasion ability check with a member of a non-halfling race once per day.

generalPerks.name: Sticky Fingers
generalPerks.description: You have Trained proficiency in Thievery.

generalPerks.name: Sure Footed
generalPerks.description: You gain a climbing speed of 10 feet

generalPerks.name: Low-Light Vision
generalPerks.description: You can see in dim light as though it were by torchlight, but cannot see in darkness.

subraces.name: Pitchburner
subraces.description:
You are resistant to Fire damage.

When fighting an opponent in melee range that you cannot see, if you can hear them, you do not suffer disadvantage on attack rolls against them and they do not gain advantage on attack rolls against you due to their hidden nature.

subraces.name: Runtboss
subraces.description: You have Trained proficiency with the Intimidation or Persuasion skill.

generalPerks.name: Brave
generalPerks.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

generalPerks.name: Martial Culture
generalPerks.description: You gain Trained proficiency in the Athletics skill.

generalPerks.name: Saving Face
generalPerks.description: If you miss an attack roll or fail an ability check or saving throw, you can gain a bonus to the roll equal to the number of allies you can see within 30 feet (max +5). You can use this ability once per day.

generalPerks.name: Hobgoblin Combat Training
generalPerks.description: You are proficient with all weapons.

generalPerks.name: Formation Training
generalPerks.description: You gain the following reaction: If you are the target of an attack while next to an ally, you can give yourself a +1 bonus to your defense against that attack.

generalPerks.name: Keen Senses
generalPerks.description: You have advanced hearing and smell, and have advantage on perception checks relating those senses.

generalPerks.name: Low-Light Vision
generalPerks.description: You can see in dim light as though it were by torchlight, but cannot see in darkness.

subraces.name: Versatile
subraces.description: You gain an additional identity feat or ability feat

subraces.name: Half-Elf
subraces.description:
You have some of the general appearance traits of one with elven descent.

You can select up to two of your perks from the elf general perk list.

You gain an additional general perk

subraces.name: Half-Orc
subraces.description:
You have some of the general appearance traits of one of orcish descent.

You can select up to two of your perks from the orc general perk list.

You gain an additional general perk

subraces.name: Changeling (Rare)
subraces.description:
Shapechange:

As a ritual (1 minute), you can magically change your appearance and your voice. You determine the specifics of the changes, including your coloration, hair length, and sex. You can also adjust your height and weight, but not so much that your size or physiology changes.

You can make yourself appear as a member of another race, though none of your in game statistics change. You can't duplicate the appearance of a creature you've never seen, and you must adopt a form that has the same arrangement of limbs that you have.

Your clothing and equipment aren't affected by this trait. You stay in this new form until you use an action to revert to your true form, or until you die.
subraces.requirements: One of your ability boosts must be to Charisma
subraces.penalty: You receive 2 general perks instead of 3

subraces.name: Kalashtar (Rare)
subraces.description:
Whenever you are targeted by a spell or effect that causes you to make a Will saving throw, you can use your reaction to give yourself advantage on the save.

You have resistance to Psychic damage.
subraces.requirements: One of your ability boosts must be to Wisdom
subraces.penalty: You receive 2 general perks instead of 3

generalPerks.name: Practiced
generalPerks.description: You gain one skill increase to a skill of your choosing

generalPerks.name: Talented
generalPerks.description: You gain Apprentice proficiency in a skill of your choosing

generalPerks.name: Martialist
generalPerks.description: You gain proficiency with simple weapons. If you already have proficiency with simple weapons, you gain proficiency with martial weapons.

generalPerks.name: Stronger Together
generalPerks.description: You have advantage on all checks to assist an ally in a skill that you have at least Trained proficiency level in.

generalPerks.name: Human Determination
generalPerks.description: When you roll a 1 on an attack roll, Ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die. You must use the new result, even if it is a 1.

generalPerks.name: Knack
generalPerks.description: When you attempt a skill check for a skill that you are untrained in, you may treat the roll as if you had Apprentice proficiency in that skill.

generalPerks.name: Mage's Apprentice
generalPerks.description: You learn a cantrip of your choice from a spell list of your choice. Your casting ability for this spell is Intelligence for Arcane Spells, and Wisdom for Divine and Primal Spells. You are proficient in this spell.

generalPerks.name: Human Adaptability
generalPerks.description: You gain a 10 foot climbing or swimming speed, or increase one of those two movement speeds by 10 feet.

generalPerks.name: Skillful Deceiver
generalPerks.description: You gain Apprentice proficiency in Deception and Stealth.

generalPerks.name: Mind Link
generalPerks.description:
You can speak telepathically to any creature you can see within a number of feet equal to 10 * your level. You don't need to share a language for the creature to understand you, but the creature must be able to understand at least one language.

When you're using this trait to speak with a creature telepathically, you may use your action to allow the creature to speak back to you telepathically. Once allowed, this effect lasts for one hour or until you use another action to end the link. The creature may only speak back as long as they are within the traits range and can see you.

Opening a link to another creature severs the link with the original creature

generalPerks.name: Severed from Dreams
generalPerks.description: You are immune to spells and other magical effects that would cause you to dream, and as a byproduct are immune to non-magical effects that would put you to sleep.

halfOrcPerks.name: Aggressive
halfOrcPerks.description: You gain the following reaction: When an enemy ends their movement within sight range, you can move up to your speed towards them.

halfOrcPerks.name: Fearsome Prowess
halfOrcPerks.description: You gain the Trained proficiency level in the Athletics or Intimidation skill.

halfOrcPerks.name: Powerful Build
halfOrcPerks.description: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift. The movement penalty for armor and shields is reduced by 5 feet.

halfOrcPerks.name: Savage Attacks
halfOrcPerks.description: When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.

halfOrcPerks.name: Relentless Endurance
halfOrcPerks.description: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can use this ability once per day.

halfOrcPerks.name: Overlooked Brute
halfOrcPerks.description: You gain the Apprentice proficiency level in Deception, and have advantage on deception checks to make yourself appear less intelligent than you are.

halfOrcPerks.name: Low-Light Vision
halfOrcPerks.description: You can see in dim light as though it were by torchlight, but cannot see in darkness.

halfElfPerks.name: Elf Magic
halfElfPerks.description:
You know one cantrip of your choice from the Arcane or Primal spell list. If you chose an Arcane spell, Intelligence is your spellcasting modifier for it. If you chose a Primal spell, Wisdom is your spellcasting modifier for it.

You are proficient in the casting of this spell.

halfElfPerks.name: Elven Weapon Training
halfElfPerks.description: You are proficient with the longsword, shortsword, shortbow, and longbow.

halfElfPerks.name: Fleet of Foot
halfElfPerks.description: You gain Apprentice proficiency in the Acrobatics skill, and each of your movement speeds increases by 5 feet.

halfElfPerks.name: Mask of the Wild
halfElfPerks.description: You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

halfElfPerks.name: Vast Knowledge (Requires age 250+)
halfElfPerks.description: You gain the Trained proficiency in a skill of your choice.

halfElfPerks.name: Elven Step
halfElfPerks.description: When you Step, you may move up to half your movement speed rather than the standard 5 feet.

halfElfPerks.name: Low-Light Vision
halfElfPerks.description: You can see in dim light as though it were by torchlight, but cannot see in darkness.

subraces.name: Wetlander
subraces.description:
You are resistant to poison damage.

You gain a swim speed of 15 feet, and can hold your breath up to 15 minutes.

subraces.name: Landstrider
subraces.description: You are resistant to Fire damage, and can go 10x longer than a normal creature without food or water.

subraces.name: Frilled
subraces.description: You have the Trained proficiency level in intimidation, and can demoralize foes without sharing a language.

subraces.name: Cliffscale
subraces.description: You gain a climbing speed of 15 feet and, as long as you aren't wearing footwear, can cling to walls and ceilings with your feet leaving your hands free for actions.

generalPerks.name: Adaptive Skin
generalPerks.description: The pigment and patterning of your scales constantly adjust to match your surroundings. In areas that your skin has had time to match to the area (1 hour), you have advantage on stealth checks while remaining still.

generalPerks.name: Cunning Artisan
generalPerks.description:
As part of a short rest, you can harvest bone and hide from a slain beast, construct, dragon, monstrosity, or plant creature of size Small or larger to create one of the following items: a shield, a club, a javelin, or 1d4 darts or blowgun needles.

To use this trait, you need a blade, such as a dagger, or appropriate artisan's tools, such as leatherworker's tools.

generalPerks.name: Hunter's Talent
generalPerks.description: You gain the Apprentice proficiency level in two of the following skills of your choice: Nature, Perception, Stealth, and Survival.

generalPerks.name: Hardened Scales
generalPerks.description: Your scales provide you with a natural suit of armor. Your scales provide a Defense bonus of +3, with no Dexterity cap, and an Armor value of 1.

generalPerks.name: Hungry Jaws
generalPerks.description:
In battle, you can throw yourself into a vicious feeding frenzy, chomping down on your foes. This bite attack does damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier, and provides you with a number of temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt with this attack.

You are proficient in this attack, but can only gain its additional benefits once per day.

generalPerks.name: Reptilian Healing
generalPerks.description: You heal far faster than other races. Whenever you recover hit points at the end of a rest, you regain additional hit points equal to your level.

generalPerks.name: Low-Light Vision
generalPerks.description: You can see in dim light as though it were by torchlight, but cannot see in darkness.

name: Merfolk
ability: You can breathe both air and water

subraces.name: Deep Dweller
subraces.description: You have adapted to living without the use of your sight. You gain a blindsight with a range of 15 feet.

subraces.name: Oceanic Predator
subraces.description: You have resistance to Cold and Poison damage.

generalPerks.name: Skilled Hunter
generalPerks.description: You have apprentice level proficiency in stealth and survival.

generalPerks.name: Emissary of the Sea
generalPerks.description: Aquatic beasts have an extraordinary affinity with your people. You can communicate simple ideas with beasts that can breathe water. They can understand the meaning of your words, though you have no special ability to understand them in return.

generalPerks.name: Primordialist
generalPerks.description:
You learn a cantrip of your choice from the Primal spell list. Constitution is your casting modifier for this cantrip.

You are proficient in the casting of this spell

generalPerks.name: Royal Outsider
generalPerks.description: Despite being outsiders to common culture, Triton's carry an air of nobility and societal familiarity with them from the depths. You gain Apprentice proficiency in the Persuasion and Society skills.

generalPerks.name: Swift
generalPerks.description: Your land and swim speeds each increase by 5 feet

generalPerks.name: Undauntable Personality
generalPerks.description: When you fail a Will saving throw, you can use your reaction to reroll the save and keep the new result. You can use this ability once per day.

generalPerks.name: Low-Light Vision
generalPerks.description: You can see in dim light as though it were by torchlight, but cannot see in darkness.

subraces.name: Primalist
subraces.description: You learn a cantrip of your choice from the Primal spell list. Wisdom is your casting modifier for this cantrip. You are proficient in the casting of this spell

subraces.name: Runed-flesh
subraces.description: Whenever you succeed a saving throw against a magical effect, you gain temporary hit points equal to your constitution modifier.

subraces.name: Wanderer
subraces.description: You gain a 10 foot bonus to your movement speed

subraces.name: War-Scarred
subraces.description:
You gain an additional 4 hit points as part of your racial bonus at level 1.

When making death saving throws, you require 4 failed death saves instead of 3 in order to die.

name: Runemade
ability: You donâ€™t need to eat, drink, or breathe. You are immune to disease and the poisoned condition.

subraces.name: Envoy
subraces.description:
You learn an additional language.

You gain trained proficiency in a skill of your choice

subraces.name: Juggernaut
subraces.description:
You gain an additional 4 hit points as part of your racial bonus at level 1.

When making death saving throws, you require 4 failed death saves instead of 3 in order to die.

generalPerks.name: Integrated Armor
generalPerks.description: You gain a permanent +1 bonus to both Defense and Armor. You can rest normally no matter the style of armor you are wearing, and no longer need to remove your armor for any reason.

generalPerks.name: Swift
generalPerks.description: Your movement speed increases by 10 feet.

generalPerks.name: Powerful Build
generalPerks.description: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift. You automatically meet the strength requirement for all armors and shields.

generalPerks.name: Sentry's Rest
generalPerks.description: You do not lose consciousness when you rest, and can instead remain motionless and alert for 6 hours to gain the benefits of a full night's rest.

generalPerks.name: Iron Fists
generalPerks.description: Your iron fists hit just as hard as any weapon. Your unarmed attacks do 1d6 + your strength modifier bludgeoning damage. You are proficient in these attacks.

generalPerks.name: Specialized Design
generalPerks.description: You gain apprentice proficiency in a skill of your choice.

generalPerks.name: Low-Light Vision
generalPerks.description: You can see in dim light as though it were by torchlight, but cannot see in darkness.

name: Shifter
ability:
Shifting:

As an action, you can assume a more bestial appearance. This transformation lasts for one minute, until you die, or until you revert to your normal appearance as a free action (whichever comes first). When you shift, you gain temporary hit points equal to your level + your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1 temporary hit point).

You also gain additional bonuses according to your subspecies.

subraces.name: Beasthide
subraces.description: Whenever you shift, you again 1d8+ your Constitution Modifier in temporary hit points. While shifted, you have a +1 bonus to your Defense and Armor

subraces.name: Longtooth
subraces.description:
While shifted, you can use your elongated claws or fangs to attack as an action. This attack does not suffer the multi-attack penalty. If you hit, you can deal 1d6 + your strength modifier as piercing damage to your target.

Your proficiency with this attack begins at Apprentice at level 1, and increases to Trained at level 6, Expert at level 11, and Master at level 16.

subraces.name: Swiftstride
subraces.description: Whenever you shift, your land speed increases by 10 feet. Additionally, while shifted, you can disengage as a reaction when a creature ends its turn within 5 feet of you.

subraces.name: Wildhunt
subraces.description: While shifted, you have advantage on Wisdom related skill checks, and no creature within 30 feet may make an attack roll with advantage against you (as long as you arent incapacitated).

generalPerks.name: Bestial Nature
generalPerks.description: You gain the Trained proficiency level in the Athletics, Intimidation, Acrobatics, or Survival skill.

generalPerks.name: Animal Endurance
generalPerks.description: When you fail a fortitude save, you can use your reaction to reroll the save and keep the new result. You can use this ability once per shift, and only while shifted.

generalPerks.name: Powerful Build
generalPerks.description: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift. The movement penalty for armor and shields is reduced by 5 feet.

generalPerks.name: Relentless Endurance
generalPerks.description: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can use this ability once per day.

generalPerks.name: Persistent Adaptation
generalPerks.description: You gain a climbing or swimming speed of 10 feet.

generalPerks.name: Low-Light Vision
generalPerks.description: You can see in dim light as though it were by torchlight, but cannot see in darkness.

subraces.name: Faustian
subraces.description:
You have Apprentice proficiency in the Persuasion and Society skills.

Your social interactions with other people are uninhibited by your fiendish appearance, and do not suffer the normal stigma associated with your appearance.

subraces.name: Infernal Born
subraces.description:
You know the Produce Flame cantrip and can cast the spell Hellish Rebuke at 2nd level (once per day). Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

You are proficient in the casting of these spells.

subraces.name: Branded One
subraces.description:
You are resistant to Fire damage.

You know the Thaumaturgy cantrip.

generalPerks.name: Skillful Tail
generalPerks.description: Your tail is capable of performing simple interactions, like opening an unlocked door. Your tail is incapable of any task that requires finders or significant manual dexterity, but can be used to hold simple objects.

generalPerks.name: Silver-tongued
generalPerks.description: You gain the Trained proficiency level in deception.

generalPerks.name: Cloven Hoof
generalPerks.description: Your move speed increases by 5 feet.

generalPerks.name: Fiend's Door
generalPerks.description:
Once per day you can cast the spell Misty Step without expending a spell charge or using any material components.

Additionally, you don't need to be able to see your destination in order to teleport there. Even if you have additional spell charges, you cannot cast this spell this way using another spellcasting feature.

generalPerks.name: Resist in Kind
generalPerks.description: You gain advantage on all Will saving throws against magical effects cast or caused by Fiendish enemies.

generalPerks.name: Infernal Ally
generalPerks.description:
You gain a familiar ally bound to you through the chaos in your blood. This familiar takes whatever form you choose.

This familiar behaves as though summoned by the find familiar spell (with the following changes) and you can cast Find Familiar (without expending any spell charges or material components) only to resummon this familiar.

Your familiar is always of the type: Fiend, your familiar is incapable of changing its physical form even when resummoned, and your familiar is incapable of taking any actions in combat

generalPerks.description: You can see in dim light as though it were by torchlight, but cannot see in darkness.
